title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Zechariah chapter 14 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Zechariah Chapter 14.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 14:1, what will happen on the day of the LORD?
options: Thy spoil shall be divided in the midst of thee
The city shall be rebuilt
The mountains shall be covered with snow
The people shall sing songs of joy
questions.correctAnswer: Thy spoil shall be divided in the midst of thee
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:1 states that on the day of the LORD, thy spoil shall be divided in the midst of thee.

questions.question: Who will be gathered against Jerusalem to battle according to Zechariah 14:2?
options: All nations
Only Israel
The twelve tribes
The neighbors of Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: All nations
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:2 states that all nations will be gathered against Jerusalem to battle.

questions.question: Where will the LORD stand on that day as described in Zechariah 14:4?
options: Upon the mount of Olives
On the temple mount
On Mount Zion
In the valley of Jehoshaphat
questions.correctAnswer: Upon the mount of Olives
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:4 says the LORD's feet shall stand upon the mount of Olives.

questions.question: True or False: According to Zechariah 14:6, the light on that day shall be clear and bright.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:6 states that the light on that day shall not be clear nor dark.

questions.question: What will flow out from Jerusalem in that day according to Zechariah 14:8?
options: Living waters
Fire
Smoke
Blood
questions.correctAnswer: Living waters
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:8 states that living waters shall go out from Jerusalem.

questions.question: Who will be king over all the earth in that day as per Zechariah 14:9?
options: The LORD
A human king
The king of Babylon
The king of Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:9 says the LORD shall be king over all the earth in that day.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 14:11 says Jerusalem shall be safely inhabited with no more utter destruction.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:11 confirms that Jerusalem shall be safely inhabited with no more utter destruction.

questions.question: What will happen to the flesh of those who fight against Jerusalem, according to Zechariah 14:12?
options: It shall consume away while they stand upon their feet
It shall become strong and healthy
It shall be covered with scars
It shall multiply
questions.correctAnswer: It shall consume away while they stand upon their feet
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:12 describes that their flesh shall consume away while they stand upon their feet.

questions.question: The great tumult from the LORD will cause people to do what to their neighbors in Zechariah 14:13?
options: Lay hold on the hand of his neighbour, and his hand shall rise up against the hand of his neighbour
Sing hymns together
Pray for peace
Build houses
questions.correctAnswer: Lay hold on the hand of his neighbour, and his hand shall rise up against the hand of his neighbour
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:13 states there will be a great tumult causing this conflict between neighbors.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 14:14 mentions that Judah shall fight at Jerusalem and gather great wealth from the heathen around.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:14 confirms Judah will fight at Jerusalem and gather wealth from surrounding heathen.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Zechariah 14:16: 'Every one that is left of all the nations which came against Jerusalem shall go up from year to year to worship the ______, the LORD of hosts.'
options: King
Prophet
Priest
Judge
questions.correctAnswer: King
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:16 states they shall come to worship the King, the LORD of hosts.

questions.question: What will happen to those who do not come up to Jerusalem to worship, according to Zechariah 14:17?
options: They shall have no rain
They shall be blessed
They shall be given peace
They shall prosper
questions.correctAnswer: They shall have no rain
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:17 says those who do not come up to worship will have no rain.

questions.question: What is written upon the bells of the horses in that day, according to Zechariah 14:20?
options: HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD
Victory and Peace
Glory to God
The Name of Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:20 says the bells of the horses shall have HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 14:21, in that day there shall be no more what in the house of the LORD of hosts?
options: The Canaanite
The Levite
The prophet
The priest
questions.correctAnswer: The Canaanite
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:21 states there shall be no more the Canaanite in the house of the LORD of hosts.

questions.question: What shall the pots in the LORD's house be like, as stated in Zechariah 14:20?
options: Like the bowls before the altar
Like the vessels of gold
Like the vessels of silver
Like the chalices of the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Like the bowls before the altar
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:20 describes the pots in the LORD's house as being like the bowls before the altar.

medium.title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Zechariah Chapter 14 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is going through a trial and asks you for counsel. Based on Zechariah 14, what biblical truth would you share about God's protection and victory?
options: The LORD will fight for His people and bring deliverance
We must rely only on our own strength
God will allow defeat to teach us humility
Victory comes from wealth and weapons
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD will fight for His people and bring deliverance
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:3 says the LORD will fight against the nations as on the day of battle, assuring believers that God is their defender. This is reinforced in verses 1-2 where despite the city's trial, not all are cut off, and in verse 9 where the LORD reigns over all the earth.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 14 teach us about humility and trust in God during times of conflict?
options: We should trust God's intervention rather than our own plans
We should rely on alliances and human strength
Winning is guaranteed by military power alone
Avoid prayer and depend on political solutions
questions.correctAnswer: We should trust God's intervention rather than our own plans
questions.explanation: The chapter emphasizes God’s direct action (verse 3), the LORD standing on the Mount of Olives (verse 4), and His judgment upon the attacking nations (verses 12-13), showing that trusting God is essential rather than human strategies.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged about praying for their city. Based on Zechariah 14, what encouragement about prayer and God’s kingship can you share?
options: The LORD will be king over all the earth and unify all
Prayer has no effect on God’s plans
God only cares for individuals, not cities
God’s kingdom is limited to heaven only
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD will be king over all the earth and unify all
questions.explanation: Verse 9 clearly states that the LORD will be king over all the earth, indicating that God's rule encompasses everything and encourages believers to trust in His sovereign kingship and power.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 14 teach about perseverance through trials?
options: Though Jerusalem will face hardships, it will be safely inhabited
Trials mean God has abandoned His people
Suffering is to be avoided at all costs
God guarantees an easy life for believers
questions.correctAnswer: Though Jerusalem will face hardships, it will be safely inhabited
questions.explanation: Verse 11 promises no more utter destruction and safe habitation, showing that trials are temporary and God’s ultimate protection brings perseverance and hope.

questions.question: A believer struggles with forgiveness after conflict. What does Zechariah 14 teach about God’s justice and reconciliation in such circumstances?
options: God will bring justice on enemies but also establish peace and worship
Revenge is encouraged without limit
Justice means endless conflict
Forgiveness is unnecessary
questions.correctAnswer: God will bring justice on enemies but also establish peace and worship
questions.explanation: Verses 12-14 describe God’s judgment on those who fight Jerusalem, but verses 16-19 show that survivors will come to worship the LORD, indicating justice leads to reconciliation and worship.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 14 encourage believers to live with integrity and holiness in their daily lives?
options: Every pot in Jerusalem and Judah shall be holiness unto the LORD
Only priests need to be holy
Holiness is not relevant to daily activities
Holiness is optional for believers
questions.correctAnswer: Every pot in Jerusalem and Judah shall be holiness unto the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 21 teaches that all utensils used by the people will be holy, symbolizing that holiness is to permeate every aspect of life, encouraging believers to live with integrity and devotion.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with contentment during scarcity. What hope does Zechariah 14 provide about God’s provision?
options: Living waters will flow from Jerusalem, providing constant provision
God will abandon His people in scarcity
Provision depends solely on human effort
Scarcity is permanent and unchangeable
questions.correctAnswer: Living waters will flow from Jerusalem, providing constant provision
questions.explanation: Verse 8 promises living waters flowing from Jerusalem in summer and winter, symbolizing God’s continual provision and encouraging believers to trust Him in all seasons.

questions.question: True or False: According to Zechariah 14, those who refuse to worship the LORD during the feast of tabernacles will face drought.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 17 states that those who do not come to worship the LORD will have no rain, showing the importance of obedience and worship in God’s covenant.

questions.question: True or False: Zechariah 14 teaches that God’s judgment on enemies will cause their flesh, eyes, and tongue to consume away while standing.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 12 describes a plague where their flesh, eyes, and tongue will consume away while they stand, emphasizing the severity of God’s judgment on those who oppose Him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Zechariah 14:4 says that on the day the LORD stands on the Mount of Olives, the mountain shall _____ in the midst thereof.
options: cleave toward the east and toward the west
be covered with snow
be surrounded by fire
be moved to Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: cleave toward the east and toward the west
questions.explanation: Verse 4 clearly states the Mount of Olives will cleave in the midst toward east and west, showing God’s powerful intervention in history.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 14 teach about generosity and stewardship in times of blessing?
options: The wealth of all heathen will be gathered in great abundance to Jerusalem
Wealth should be hoarded selfishly
Blessings are only for personal gain
Stewardship is optional
questions.correctAnswer: The wealth of all heathen will be gathered in great abundance to Jerusalem
questions.explanation: Verse 14 shows that after victory, wealth from surrounding nations will be gathered, indicating God’s provision and the importance of managing blessings wisely for His purposes.

questions.question: A believer wonders about the significance of worship and obedience. What does Zechariah 14 teach about regular worship and keeping God’s feasts?
options: All nations left after judgment will worship the LORD yearly at the feast of tabernacles
Worship is optional and personal
Feasts are outdated and irrelevant
Only some chosen individuals need to worship
questions.correctAnswer: All nations left after judgment will worship the LORD yearly at the feast of tabernacles
questions.explanation: Verse 16 shows the importance of yearly worship and keeping the feast of tabernacles as an act of obedience and fellowship with God.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 14 encourage believers to maintain integrity and honesty in the face of adversity?
options: God’s judgment on enemies demonstrates the consequences of violence and unfaithfulness
Dishonesty will be overlooked in trials
Integrity is not important during conflict
Adversity justifies unethical behavior
questions.correctAnswer: God’s judgment on enemies demonstrates the consequences of violence and unfaithfulness
questions.explanation: Verses 12-13 describe God’s plague and tumult on those who fight Jerusalem, showing the importance of living honestly and righteously even in trials.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with humility. Based on Zechariah 14, what biblical truth can you share about God’s sovereignty?
options: There shall be one LORD, and His name one
God shares His throne with many gods
God’s sovereignty is limited
Humility is unnecessary since humans control all
questions.correctAnswer: There shall be one LORD, and His name one
questions.explanation: Verse 9 emphasizes the LORD’s singular kingship over all the earth, encouraging believers to humble themselves before His supreme authority.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 14 highlight the importance of fellowship and unity among God’s people?
options: All nations will come yearly to Jerusalem to worship the LORD together
Believers should isolate themselves
Unity is unimportant in worship
Worship is a solitary activity only
questions.correctAnswer: All nations will come yearly to Jerusalem to worship the LORD together
questions.explanation: Verse 16 shows that after judgment, surviving nations will assemble yearly in unity to worship, teaching the value of communal worship and fellowship.

hard.title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Zechariah Chapter 14.

questions.question: In Zechariah 14:4, what significant geographical event involving the Mount of Olives is described?
options: The Mount of Olives will split into two halves, creating a great valley
The Mount of Olives will be completely consumed by fire
The Mount of Olives will be covered by a great flood
The Mount of Olives will be removed entirely from Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: The Mount of Olives will split into two halves, creating a great valley
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:4 describes the Mount of Olives cleaving in the midst toward the east and west, creating a very great valley, indicating a dramatic geographical change.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'the day of the LORD' as used in Zechariah 14:1 in the context of Old Testament prophecy?
options: It denotes a future time of divine judgment and restoration
It refers solely to a past historical battle
It symbolizes the creation of the world
It is a metaphor for Israel's agricultural season
questions.correctAnswer: It denotes a future time of divine judgment and restoration
questions.explanation: The 'day of the LORD' in prophetic literature, including Zechariah 14:1, typically refers to a future time when God intervenes decisively in history for judgment and salvation.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 14:2, what will happen to the city of Jerusalem during the nations' attack?
options: The city will be taken, houses rifled, women ravished, and half the city taken captive
The city will be miraculously protected from any harm
The city will be abandoned without a battle
The city will be completely destroyed with no survivors
questions.correctAnswer: The city will be taken, houses rifled, women ravished, and half the city taken captive
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:2 details the assault on Jerusalem involving capture, plunder, and partial captivity, showing a partial but not total destruction.

questions.question: The plague described in Zechariah 14:12 affects the enemies of Jerusalem in what specific way?
options: Their flesh, eyes, and tongue will consume away while standing
They will be struck down by fire from heaven
They will be swallowed by the earth
They will be blinded but physically unharmed
questions.correctAnswer: Their flesh, eyes, and tongue will consume away while standing
questions.explanation: The verse vividly describes a plague causing bodily decay while standing, emphasizing God's direct judgment on the attacking nations.

questions.question: What theme of universal worship is introduced in Zechariah 14:16-17?
options: All nations left after the battle will annually go to Jerusalem to worship the LORD
Only Israel will worship the LORD exclusively
Worship will cease entirely after the battle
Worship will be limited to private homes
questions.correctAnswer: All nations left after the battle will annually go to Jerusalem to worship the LORD
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:16-17 portrays a future time when surviving nations come yearly to Jerusalem to honor the LORD, highlighting universal recognition of God’s kingship.

questions.question: In Zechariah 14:9, what is proclaimed about the LORD’s kingship?
options: The LORD shall be king over all the earth, and His name one
The LORD will only be king over Israel
The LORD's kingship will be divided among many gods
The LORD relinquishes His kingship to earthly rulers
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD shall be king over all the earth, and His name one
questions.explanation: This verse asserts God’s universal sovereignty and the unity of His name, emphasizing monotheism and divine reign.

questions.question: What literary device is prominently used in Zechariah 14:13 where neighbors rise against each other amid a great tumult?
options: Chiasm
Simile
Hyperbole
Paradox
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm
questions.explanation: The verse uses chiasm by reversing the subjects and objects (hand against hand), underscoring internal conflict among enemies.

questions.question: The phrase 'HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD' on the bells of horses in Zechariah 14:20 is an example of what type of Hebrew literary device?
options: Sacred inscription indicating consecration
A metaphor for battle readiness
An idiom meaning victory
A euphemism for peace
questions.correctAnswer: Sacred inscription indicating consecration
questions.explanation: This phrase marks objects as dedicated to God, a common Hebrew practice to signify holiness and separation for divine purposes.

questions.question: How does the imagery of 'living waters' flowing from Jerusalem in Zechariah 14:8 relate to other Biblical themes?
options: It symbolizes spiritual renewal and God’s provision, similar to imagery in Ezekiel and Revelation
It refers solely to a natural spring with no symbolic meaning
It symbolizes a curse upon the land
It represents a historical irrigation system
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes spiritual renewal and God’s provision, similar to imagery in Ezekiel and Revelation
questions.explanation: Living waters in Zechariah echo prophetic visions of restoration and life-giving provision found in Ezekiel 47 and Revelation 22.

questions.question: True or False: According to Zechariah 14:6-7, the day described will be normal with clear distinctions between day and night.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 6 and 7 describe a unique day not clearly light or dark, known only to the LORD, indicating an extraordinary divine event.

questions.question: What historical event is alluded to in Zechariah 14:5 when it references fleeing 'like as ye fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah'?
options: An earthquake during King Uzziah’s reign
A foreign invasion during King David’s reign
The destruction of the Temple by Babylon
The exodus from Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: An earthquake during King Uzziah’s reign
questions.explanation: The text references a known earthquake in Uzziah’s time, linking the future flight to a past historical disaster.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 14:14, what happens to the wealth of the heathen surrounding Jerusalem during the conflict?
options: It will be gathered in great abundance by Judah
It will be destroyed and lost forever
It will be given to the poor of Jerusalem
It will be hidden to prevent plunder
questions.correctAnswer: It will be gathered in great abundance by Judah
questions.explanation: The verse states Judah will fight at Jerusalem and gather the wealth of surrounding nations, showing divine provision for Israel.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Zechariah 14:21 states that in that day there shall be no more the ______ in the house of the LORD of hosts.
options: Canaanite
Philistine
Babylonian
Egyptian
questions.correctAnswer: Canaanite
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly mentions the absence of the Canaanite in the LORD’s house, symbolizing purification and holiness.

questions.question: What is the consequence mentioned in Zechariah 14:17 for any family of the earth that does not come up to Jerusalem to worship the King, the LORD of hosts?
options: They will have no rain
They will be exiled from their land
They will be struck by pestilence
They will lose their armies
questions.correctAnswer: They will have no rain
questions.explanation: The verse warns that failure to worship the LORD in Jerusalem results in drought, a common biblical sign of divine judgment.

questions.question: What does Zechariah 14:15 say about the plague affecting the animals in the tents of the nations that fought against Jerusalem?
options: The plague will affect horses, mules, camels, asses, and all beasts like the plague on people
Only the horses will be affected by the plague
The plague will spare all animals
The plague is a metaphor for famine
questions.correctAnswer: The plague will affect horses, mules, camels, asses, and all beasts like the plague on people
questions.explanation: The verse parallels the plague on the people with a similar plague on their animals, showing comprehensive judgment.

theological.title: Zechariah Chapter 14 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Zechariah Chapter 14 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 14:4, where will the LORD's feet stand on the day He fights against the nations?
options: Mount of Olives
Mount Zion
Mount Carmel
Mount Sinai
questions.correctAnswer: Mount of Olives
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:4 states that the LORD's feet shall stand upon the Mount of Olives on that day. This mountain is significant in biblical prophecy as the place where the Messiah will stand (Acts 1:11; Ezekiel 43:7; Joel 3:17; Revelation 14:1).

questions.question: What is the significance of the day described in Zechariah 14:7 as 'not day, nor night'?
options: It is a unique day known only to the LORD
It is a regular day with normal light and darkness
It is a night of complete darkness
It is a day of eternal night
questions.correctAnswer: It is a unique day known only to the LORD
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:7 explains this day will be unique, neither day nor night, but known to the LORD alone. This reflects the eschatological day of the LORD (Joel 2:31; Isaiah 13:10; 2 Peter 3:10; Revelation 6:12) when God's sovereign intervention transforms time and creation.

questions.question: What plague does the LORD send upon those who fight against Jerusalem as described in Zechariah 14:12?
options: Their flesh, eyes, and tongue will consume away while standing
Sudden blindness
Famine and drought
Plague of locusts
questions.correctAnswer: Their flesh, eyes, and tongue will consume away while standing
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:12 describes a supernatural plague where the enemies' flesh, eyes, and tongue consume away while they stand. This judgment echoes divine plagues in Exodus 9:6, 2 Chronicles 7:20, and Revelation 16:2, demonstrating God's sovereign power over His enemies.

questions.question: In Zechariah 14:9, what title is given to the LORD in the eschatological day?
options: King over all the earth
Judge of the nations
Prince of Peace
Son of Man
questions.correctAnswer: King over all the earth
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:9 declares that the LORD will be King over all the earth, emphasizing His universal reign and divine sovereignty. This is consistent with Psalm 24:10, Isaiah 6:5, Revelation 15:3, and Daniel 7:14 where God or the Messiah is recognized as King over all creation.

questions.question: What will flow from Jerusalem according to Zechariah 14:8?
options: Living waters
Fire and brimstone
Smoke and ashes
Golden light
questions.correctAnswer: Living waters
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:8 predicts living waters flowing from Jerusalem, symbolizing life, healing, and restoration. This imagery aligns with Ezekiel 47:1-12, John 7:38, Revelation 22:1-2, and Psalm 46:4, all portraying God's provision and eternal life through His Spirit.

questions.question: What will happen to the Mount of Olives on the day the LORD stands upon it, according to Zechariah 14:4?
options: It will cleave in the midst, creating a great valley
It will be covered with snow
It will become a desert
It will be surrounded by fire
questions.correctAnswer: It will cleave in the midst, creating a great valley
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:4 indicates that the Mount of Olives will split, forming a great valley, symbolizing a dramatic divine intervention in history. This connects with Ezekiel 38:20 and Exodus 19:18 where mountains are reshaped by God's power, signaling eschatological transformation.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 14:16, what will the remnant of nations that came against Jerusalem do annually?
options: Go up to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, and keep the feast of tabernacles
Offer sacrifices to their own gods
Stay away from Jerusalem
Fight against Jerusalem again
questions.correctAnswer: Go up to worship the King, the LORD of hosts, and keep the feast of tabernacles
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:16 prophesies that the remaining nations will annually worship the LORD in Jerusalem and observe the feast of tabernacles, pointing to a future universal worship of God (Isaiah 2:3; Psalm 86:9; Revelation 21:24; Micah 4:2).

questions.question: What consequence does Zechariah 14:17 warn for those who do not come to Jerusalem to worship the LORD?
options: They will have no rain
They will be exiled
They will be given over to wild beasts
They will be struck by lightning
questions.correctAnswer: They will have no rain
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:17 states that those who refuse to come to Jerusalem to worship the LORD will receive no rain, signifying divine judgment and withdrawal of blessing, similar to Deuteronomy 11:17, Jeremiah 14:1, Malachi 3:10, and James 5:17.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 14:20, what will be written on the bells of the horses in that day?
options: 'HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD'
'Victory to the King'
'Peace and Safety'
'Judgment Day'
questions.correctAnswer: 'HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD'
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:20 specifies that the bells of the horses will bear the inscription 'HOLINESS UNTO THE LORD,' indicating sacred dedication and God's sovereignty, parallel to Exodus 28:36, Leviticus 27:28, Revelation 4:8, and Isaiah 6:3.

questions.question: What will happen to the Canaanite in the house of the LORD on that day, according to Zechariah 14:21?
options: There shall be no more the Canaanite
They will be the priests of the LORD
They will be honored guests
They will rebuild the temple
questions.correctAnswer: There shall be no more the Canaanite
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:21 states there will no longer be the Canaanite in the house of the LORD, symbolizing the removal of impurity and idolatry. This corresponds with the purification of God's people in Exodus 34:11, Psalm 87:4, Jeremiah 3:10, and Revelation 21:27.

questions.question: How does Zechariah 14:3 describe the LORD’s action against the nations that fight Jerusalem?
options: The LORD will go forth and fight as in the day of battle
The LORD will send angels to destroy them
The LORD will forgive them
The LORD will hide Jerusalem from them
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD will go forth and fight as in the day of battle
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:3 states the LORD will personally fight against the nations, reminiscent of His past mighty acts (Exodus 14:14; Joshua 10:14; Psalm 24:8; Isaiah 42:13), demonstrating God's active role in salvation history.

questions.question: What will happen to the beasts in the tents of those who fight against Jerusalem according to Zechariah 14:15?
options: They will be struck by the same plague as the people
They will be taken captive
They will flee to the wilderness
They will multiply abundantly
questions.correctAnswer: They will be struck by the same plague as the people
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:15 describes a plague upon the horse, mule, camel, ass, and all beasts in the tents, showing comprehensive divine judgment. This aligns with Exodus 9:3, 1 Samuel 5:6, and Revelation 6:8 where God's judgment affects both people and animals.

questions.question: According to Zechariah 14:10, how will the land around Jerusalem be changed?
options: It shall be turned into a plain and lifted up, inhabited securely
It shall be covered with thick forests
It shall be flooded with water
It shall be destroyed and desolate
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be turned into a plain and lifted up, inhabited securely
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:10 prophesies that the land will be transformed into a plain and lifted up, with secure habitation in Jerusalem. This reflects God's restoration promises (Isaiah 40:4; Ezekiel 36:35; Psalm 48:2; Jeremiah 31:38-40).

questions.question: What will happen to the spoils taken from Jerusalem according to Zechariah 14:1-2?
options: They shall be divided in the midst of the people
They shall be burned
They shall be returned to the nations
They shall be hidden in the desert
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be divided in the midst of the people
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:1-2 says that the spoil taken during the siege of Jerusalem will be divided among the people, indicating a time of distress but also preservation of a remnant, consistent with God's covenant faithfulness (Jeremiah 30:11; Ezekiel 14:22; Romans 11:5; Revelation 7:14).

questions.question: What is the nature of the light described in Zechariah 14:6 on the day of the LORD?
options: The light shall not be clear, nor dark
It shall be a bright and clear light
It shall be total darkness
It shall flicker like a candle
questions.correctAnswer: The light shall not be clear, nor dark
questions.explanation: Zechariah 14:6 indicates a peculiar light, neither fully light nor dark, symbolizing the in-between state of the eschatological day. This echoes prophetic symbolism of God's mysterious presence (Exodus 20:21; Isaiah 60:19; Matthew 27:45; Revelation 16:10).
